title: Can players report you for having internet issues
body: There is this one guy who dc'd from me game and when he comes back, he refuses to believe that people are reporting him because he made it a bad experience for the other 4 players. Apparently he found some link 2 years ago which explains that DC is not a reportable offense. My question is, can I report him for leaving the game despite him claiming to have internet issues. He has left the game, he stood in the fountain for a while until the game was pretty much at its end and his attitude is unsightly.

replies.body:
I've played with 300 + ping during the past few days, and I don't go afk in the base I just play the game and deal with the lag. However, I have been called 'trolling' because of how I move my champion due to lag. 

I'm unable to respond instantly to plays etc. This is due to the fact my screen freezes and the champs just slide around the terrain and there's no sound/abilities I'm just able to move my champ around but I cant see the fight at all so it looks like I'm doing nothing and 'trolling'.

If it's happening a lot/consistently, it's the the kind of thing you should be looking into the cause of. Sometimes all it takes is a call to your ISP threatening to leave them that gets that shit fixed.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=FsHZNH8Q,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2017-11-29T11:41:23.856+0000)
>
> If it's happening a lot/consistently, it's the the kind of thing you should be looking into the cause of. Sometimes all it takes is a call to your ISP threatening to leave them that gets that shit fixed.

yeah - whether or not it is the fault of the OP, the impact on the rest of the team remains.

If I have a sh!tty connection, I play something else.

I mean, you can report anyone for anything, whether or not it's valid report is a different issue. AFKs/DCs and their associated reports (unless it's happening often in ranked) only prompt LeaverBusters.

The short answer is yes, you can report him. If it's a once off issue it isn't going to affect him at all past that game, but if it's happening all the time then he'll get  LeaverBuster timers and will continue to do so until he gets whatever is causing the leaves sorted out.

He can refuse to believe you all he likes, it won't change anything, however whatever internet issues he may or may not have that isn't a reason to rub your reports in his face *if* that's what you were doing.
When my team were typing away at him, i said "just play the game and report him after". I guess I did kind of point it out too blatantly and am at partial fault here ...

If that's all you said I don't see anything wrong with it, just sounded from your OP like you or your team might have been taking it a bit too far when he tried to defend it. Unfortunately in an online world, especially one where the only perception you have of other people is a name and some text chat, people tend to be rather self centred and not realise that those names are actual people at the end of the day.

It's one thing to say sorry I didn't do it on purpose, but another to say you don't have the right to report him for negatively impacting your game. Assuming he doesn't do it often at worst he has to wait 5 mins next few times he wants to play, it's really not that big a deal.

look at it this way, if that was you, would you honestly feel very good knowing that ontop of not being able to play the game because of your internet service provider, you'd get reported for something you had no control over?

The player made no conscious choice to impact the experience of the other players in their game, how is being reported for that fair?

I gotta disagree with you there. By disconnecting whether it be intentional or an external factor, they are still affecting the other players on the same team. I would say this falls under "leaving the game" in the report section as he has indeed left the game regardless if its his own will to.

and then what does the report resolve? it certainly isn't received by the telco, nor does it improve their connection. It isn't behavioural, they haven't done anything wrong and it could just as likely happen to you. If your internet disconnected from a match today, do you think that you deserve a ban for that?

I've dc'd twice this week (only one of which changed the result of the game, the other we were too far ahead), I have NBN but let's face it Australian internet sucks balls.

Legitimate internet issues are either infrequent enough that you will never get even a warning to AFK/Leaving because of them, or are so frequent that you shouldn't be playing.

Last Thursday I lost internet connection to my house for roughly 3 hours starting at 11:30pm while I was in the middle of a game, when I logged back in later I didn't even get a warning, because that was one game out of roughly 50 recent games.
(I also AFKd for roughly 2-3 minutes on stream Saturday night and received no warning apart from the in game message saying I'm AFK)

Even if all 9 people report your for AFK, the bigger issue is how frequent or how significant the AFK/Leave is for how often you play.
At this stage I could AFK 10 maybe 20 games a week and never get a ban because I play so so many more games.

----------------------------------------

On the other side of things we have frequent internet issues, in this case you shouldn't be playing the game.
If your internet is never stable, you shouldn't be playing ANY online game.

You are knowingly putting your team mates or even in the case of 1v1 games the overall quality for other people is at risk.
I know I'd rather win a match of Mortal Kombat by skill rather than the opponent DCing.
but we have leave buster for that? Reporting for dc is just you being vindictive to vent your frustrations for the ruined game. If they dc'd then riot already knows.
Reports quicken the pace of Leaver Buster.

by what logic? leave buster is fully automated, report handling is mostly automated (and will probably ignore the report anyway since it has no key phrases to flag), the two systems do not interact.

The most you're doing might be to increase the chance they get flagged for being an asshole in chat, or slow their honour gain. I mean you can, if you feel like it's some form of retribution, but for the most part you're wasting your time.

As far as I know LeaverBuster uses reports to help catch the edge cases of AFKing, the people who are trying to be sneaky about it and such. 

It may not make much different for a cut and dry case of AFK/DC but it does confirm that yes, that player left the game. For cases where maybe they are still running around in the jungle or something but aren't participating it can prompt LeaverBuster to take action where it otherwise might not, or to refer the case for manual review.

If a player is being reported a lot for AFK but not being picked up by LeaverBuster, that's something that'd get looked into you know?

Even if it is just as a small way to vent frustration, there's no harm in reporting (rubbing it in their face is a different matter).
According to Riot posts when Leaver Buster was implemented, the automated process will focus more on people who are reported for AFK on top of having been AFK for the needed amount of time.

But its also not fair to the other 4 players. If you were the one of the 4, would you feel happy if you were playing the game 4 v 5 and upon the player reconnecting, he says something like "can't do much, deal with it." The rest of us didn't have a pleasant experience with the game.

yes but again, with whom does fault lie? In this case the Telco, but does reporting the player resolve anything about this? A disconnect can happen to anyone, with no way to intervene or attempt to remedy, and it's fair enough very frustrating for both sides, arguably more so for the player themselves than the team even.

They haven't willingly done anything to ruin your experience, there is no way to predict when and if you'll disconnect and work around it.

The player does have a responsibility to have a stable connection, but this is dynamic and what may be a stable connection at the start of the game, may suddenly become unserviceable without any indication or warning. 

Using an unstable connection and consistently ruining games is generally resolved by leave buster, which punishes players automatically for disconnecting from too many games. The report is only your personal frustration for what may be just an isolated incident, and isn't really very appropriate.

If it's only happened once then a report isn't going to do anything. I don't think it's ok to rub it in their face that you're going to report them of course, as far as I'm concerned that constitutes verbal abuse and would also be reportable.

If they're leaving a lot, they deserve whatever LeaverBuster they get (I know some people have irreparable internet issues, but at that point you're gonna have to accept the consequences if you are determined to play a team based online game, just as you'd accept the extra deaths you'd get in something deathmatchy), but they still don't deserve verbal abuse for it.

you can report him for that. sure it sucks that people do have problems with their connection and they don't get to play and get reported, but thats just thinking about themselves. the person who disconnected was probably selfishly thinking about themselves and how they don't want to get reported and stuff. bruv he ruined the game for the homies, just chuck him a report. i doubt i wouldn't get reported if i disconnected from the game and lost it.
